front.title: SLAAC Prefixes with Variable Interface ID (IID)

abstract.t: This draft proposes the use of a longer prefixes in PIO for SLAAC allowing a maximum prefix length of /80 with an IID of 48 bits. This would eliminate the race to the bottom concerns. This implementation uses the RA/PIO bits to carry the variable IID to ensure backwards compatibility. In the past, various IPv6 addressing models have been proposed based on a subnet hierarchy embedding a 64-bit prefix. The last remnant of IPv6 classful addressing is a inflexible interface identifier boundary at /64. This document proposes flexibility to the fixed position of that boundary for interface addressing.
